dialogue: You light a fire early in your girlhood. You stoke it and tend to it. You protect it at all costs. You don’t let it rage into a mountain of light because that’s not becoming of a girl.
You keep it secret. You let it burn - a white hot light at the center of yourself.
Hot!
You look into the eyes of other girls and see their fires flickering there, under the surface.
Woof woof!
Okay, doggie.

It’s from this point - this fire - you can create, and fight and push your way through the world. It’s from this fire that you can birth something new - a new version of yourself, or a whole new person who didn’t exist before you squeezed them into the world.
A person who will one day pee in your face without blinking.
Oh, that looks like a heavy bag, doesn’t it? He’s strong.
Hi Norma.
Shit. Baby, we should go.
No mama! Stay!
No, I don’t want to do that.
Let’s see who can lie here and be the quietest. I bet I’m gonna win.
I’m gonna talk!
Shhh. It’s the quiet game. Quiet as a mouse.

It’s my fault he doesn’t sleep. I shouldn’t be mad at him. Everyone said it and I just didn’t listen because I liked holding him while he slept on my chest like a little warm heater. But if I had put him down drowsy but awake like all the books said then he would have good sleep habits for his entire life, I would always have a clean kitchen and a good sex life, and everything would be amazing. So now that I fucked that up... now what?
Maybe if I don’t move he won’t see me.
Oh NO!
You’re drinking from the toilet? Did that seem like a good idea? People don’t drink from toilet! Doggies do!
Mama! Horsey!
All around the mulberry bush the something chased the weasel-
Okay! Hold on.
Mama fuzzy!
No I’m not!
Oh goodie. What fresh hell do I have to look forward to today? New wrinkles? New grey hair?
What the fuck?
What if I never sleep through the night ever again?
Baby - show daddy how you balance your trains! He hasn’t seen that.
Ruff! Grrrr.
He usually does it.
fuck. fuck!
Happiness is a choice. Happiness is a choice. Happiness is a choice. What’s up with that duck? What’s up with that duck? UGH! Fuck. Stop!
I need to just enjoy these moments with him. He’s going to grow up and I will be sad these days are gone. But I’m lonely. I can’t believe how alone I feel considering I’m never actually alone.
How can I still have dinner, and bath and books to get through before this day is over? What’s up with that duck? What’s up with that duck?
Shit.
mamamamamamama!
One second baby.
Oh my god! Where did you come from?
Is she your dog?
Oh baby- wait.
Look at you! You’re so beautiful. And you smell good. Like fresh strawberries. Did you just have a bath?
Look at them. Hello sweet one. Whose dogs are these?
Wait! Come back!
We’re coming with you!
Bunny!

I’m hysterical. I’m hormonal and hysterical. I’ve always thought of myself as like... a smart woman who sometimes got a little upset but was mostly cool to hang out with. But not hysterical. But at this point - I’m hysterical. I need to get my hormone levels checked.
Hay, smoke, honey, some fungal musk. Amazing. Could I always smell like this and I just wasn’t paying attention? Or... Or.
Yes, vegetables are very civilized. Dogs wouldn’t buy vegetables.
Are any of these other mothers also losing their minds while they wheel through the grocery store buying crunchy snacks? We need some crunchy snacks, right?
Cookies! Cookies cookies cookies.
Oh my gosh, Hi Sally! What are you doing here?
Mama! Poop.
Oh my-
Baby! Squirrel! Let’s get it.
Maybe it’s really this simple. It just instinct. We’re animals. He’s my cub. We eat and play and this is life.
I’ve never felt this hungry in my life. Ravenous is the word. Ravenous, baby.
I think I’m anemic.
Mmmm.
Here baby, eat.
Grrrrr.
Speak!
Just a lil’ party trick we’ve been working on.
Kitty!
Oh honey.
Eat the kitty?
Oh, honey no. We would never eat the kitty. No. I think maybe our doggie games have gone too far. Poor kitty died. But we didn’t want her to die. This was a terrible accident.
I need you to watch a cartoon while I clean up and then we will have a funeral for kitty, okay?
I’m really sorry cat. I’m really sorry.
I’m so fucked up. I’m so fucked up.
This has gone too far. Get it together.
Baby? BABY!
Have you seen a little blond boy?
I don’t want this anymore.
I’ll get blackberries and Santa.
He said salmon not Santa, baby.
You say ‘here is my skin. Here is yours. Beneath the moon we pile inside the warm cave, becoming one creature to save our warmth’.
Okay I got blackberries and Santa’s candy canes... and his head.
